# Description

My main interest is in studying trauma and collecting any methodological tools that can help me in that way. Open science is one of the latest tools I have found extremely helpful in designing good research. I am also very curious of learning about meta-theory and thinking about how empirical results can be linked to theoretical knowledge. I also like fooling around in R.

# Expertise

```{r radarPlot, eval = TRUE}

member_name <- "Milan Zarchev"
special_skill <- "code review"

OS_skills <- read_csv(here("static/OS_skills.csv")) %>%
  dplyr::filter(name %in% c("max", "min", member_name)) %>%
  dplyr::select(c("reproducible analysis", all_of(special_skill), "data sharing", "preregistration", "open source software", "open access", "data management"))

# custom radar plot
radarchart(OS_skills,
  axistype = 0, seg = 10,
  pcol = alpha("#002328", 0.8), pfcol = alpha("#00B969", 0.6), plwd = 4, centerzero = TRUE, # polygon
  cglcol = "#7e7e7e", axislabcol = "#002328", caxislabels = seq(0, 10, 2), cglwd = 0.8 # grid
)

```
